sentences.sContent: Virtually all cooking was done over coal-fired ranges.
sentences.sCn: 事实上所有的烹饪都是在烧煤的炉灶上完成的。

sentences.sContent: ...it has remained virtually unchanged since its creation...
...it has become virtually impossible for most workers to keep a balance between work and life...
...virtually all of them were studies of girls...
...While it seems that at birth virtually everyone has perfect pitch, the reasons that one child is better than another are motivation and practice...
...enrollment kept decreasing in virtually all American colleges and universities...

words.tran: [计] 虚拟的；有效的；实质上的，事实上的

trans.tranOther: You can use virtually to indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true
